snippet: The planned mass protest, which was called by activists to demand political reforms in the kingdom, never took place because of the heavy deployment of security forces.
abstract: Amnesty International calls for Saudi Arabia to immediately release six Saudis held for nearly a year in connection with mass protest that never took place; protest was called by activists to demand political reforms in the kingdom.
lead_paragraph: The planned mass protest, which was called by activists to demand political reforms in the kingdom, never took place because of the heavy deployment of security forces.

headline.seo: Saudi Arabia: Year After Protest, Six Suspects Remain in Jail, a Rights Group Says
headline.main: Saudi Arabia: One Year After Planning a Protest, Six Suspects Remain in Jail, a Rights Group Says
headline.print_headline: Saudi Arabia: One Year After Planning a Protest, Six Suspects Remain in Jail, a Rights Group Says

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
